purpose: A customizable toggle button component built on top of Radix UI's Toggle primitive with variant support using class-variance-authority

variables.name: toggleVariants
variables.purpose: Defines the styling variants for the toggle component using cva
variables.usage: Used to generate appropriate CSS classes based on variant and size props

variables.name: Toggle
variables.purpose: The main toggle component that wraps Radix UI's Toggle primitive
variables.usage: Exported for use as a customizable toggle button throughout the application

key_points: Extends Radix UI's Toggle primitive with custom styling
Supports different visual variants and sizes
Implements React forwardRef for proper ref handling
Provides consistent styling with focus states and accessibility features

patterns: Component composition pattern using Radix UI primitives
Variant pattern using class-variance-authority for flexible styling
ForwardRef pattern for proper ref forwarding
CSS-in-JS approach with Tailwind utility classes
Separation of concerns with styling logic extracted to variants
issues: No TypeScript interface explicitly exported for Toggle props, relying on inference
Limited to two variants (default and outline) - might need expansion for more use cases
No built-in icon support which is common for toggle buttons
No explicit aria-label handling which might be needed for accessibility
